title: Portfolio
text:
üìÅ My Projects
##Comparative Study of Regularization Techniques





üî¨ Project Overview
The primary objective of this project is to analyze a leukemia gene expression dataset using various penalized regression methods. The analysis applies Lasso, Ridge, and Elastic Net to identify the most significant genes associated with leukemia and to develop robust logistic regression models for classifying leukemia subtypes.


Full Report & Code
Download Full Report (PDF)

title: About Me
text:
I have always been drawn to the structure and logic of numbers. My academic path has allowed me to explore this passion deeply:

Master‚Äôs in Statistics (Expected June 2024) ‚Äì Oregon State University
Bachelor‚Äôs in Actuarial Science ‚Äì University of Ghana

Through my studies, I have gained expertise in predictive modeling, statistical computing, and high-dimensional data analysis, all of which fuel my curiosity about solving real-world problems.






I work extensively with survival analysis, Bayesian inference, generalized linear models, time series forecasting and Genomics Studies.



I have hands-on experience in using tools like SQL, Tableau, and Power BI to create dynamic, insightful reports. Clear and effective storytelling is key to making data accessible, and I strive to bridge that gap.

title: Welcome | Statistics & Data
text:
Efua Ainooson


üå∏ Hey there!
I‚Äôm Efua Ainooson. Welcome to my little corner of the internet. I‚Äôm a statistics enthusiast, a data storyteller, and a firm believer that good models (both statistical and fashion-related) make life better. I‚Äôm a graduate student in statistics. I love the thrill of solving complex problems, the beauty of a well-structured dataset, and the satisfaction of turning numbers into insights that actually matter.
Outside of work, I‚Äôm a curious learner, a fan of deep conversations, and a lover of beautiful, clean designs (because why shouldn‚Äôt data look good too?). Oh, and I absolutely love discovering creative ways to blend statistics, machine learning, and storytelling.
So go ahead‚Äîpoke around, check out my work, and let‚Äôs chat about all things stats, data, and life!
